content: शास्त्रं [शिष्यतेऽनेन शास्-ष्ट्रन्] {@--1@} An order, a command, rule, precept. {@--2@} A sacred precept or rule, scriptural injunction. {@--3@} A religious or sacred treatise, sacred book, scripture; see comps. below. {@--4@} Any department of knowledge, science; इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रं <ls>Bg. 15. 20</ls>; शास्त्रेष्वकुंठिता बुद्धिः <ls>R. 1. 19</ls>; often at the end of <ab>comp.</ab> after the word denoting the subject, or applied collectively to the whole body of teaching on that subject; वेदांतशास्त्र, न्यायशास्त्र, तर्कशास्त्र, अलंकारशास्त्र &c. {@--5@} What is learnt, knowledge; <ls>Śi. 5. 47.</ls> {@--6@} A work, treatise; तंत्रैः पंचभिरेतच्चकार सुमनोहरं शास्त्रं <ls>Pt. 1.</ls> {@--7@} Theory (<ab>opp.</ab> प्रयोग or practice); इमं मां च शास्त्रे प्रयोगे च विमृशतु <ls>M. 1.</ls>
